request.description:
### For more information
- API Docs: [https://docs.smooch.io/rest/#post-message](https://docs.smooch.io/rest/#post-message)

header.name: Cache-Control
header.description: Tells all caching mechanisms from server to client whether they may cache this object. It is measured in seconds

header.name: Connection
header.description: Options that are desired for the connection

header.name: Content-Length
header.description: The length of the response body in octets (8-bit bytes)

header.name: Content-Type
header.description: The mime type of this content

header.name: Date
header.description: The date and time that the message was sent

header.name: ETag
header.description: An identifier for a specific version of a resource, often a message digest

header.name: Expires
header.description: Gives the date/time after which the response is considered stale

header.name: Poll-Interval
header.description: Custom header

header.name: Pragma
header.description: Implementation-specific headers that may have various effects anywhere along the request-response chain.

header.name: Server
header.description: A name for the server

header.name: Strict-Transport-Security
header.description: A HSTS Policy informing the HTTP client how long to cache the HTTPS only policy and whether this applies to subdomains.

header.name: Vary
header.description: Tells downstream proxies how to match future request headers to decide whether the cached response can be used rather than requesting a fresh one from the origin server.

header.name: X-Content-Type-Options
header.description: The only defined value, "nosniff", prevents Internet Explorer from MIME-sniffing a response away from the declared content-type

header.name: X-Frame-Options
header.description: Clickjacking protection: "deny" - no rendering within a frame, "sameorigin" - no rendering if origin mismatch

header.name: X-XSS-Protection
header.description: Cross-site scripting (XSS) filter

request.description:
### For more information

response.name: Get Messages Example

header.name: Cache-Control
header.description: Tells all caching mechanisms from server to client whether they may cache this object. It is measured in seconds

header.name: Connection
header.description: Options that are desired for the connection

header.name: Content-Encoding
header.description: The type of encoding used on the data.

header.name: Content-Type
header.description: The mime type of this content

header.name: Date
header.description: The date and time that the message was sent

header.name: ETag
header.description: An identifier for a specific version of a resource, often a message digest

header.name: Expires
header.description: Gives the date/time after which the response is considered stale

header.name: Poll-Interval
header.description: Custom header

header.name: Pragma
header.description: Implementation-specific headers that may have various effects anywhere along the request-response chain.

header.name: Server
header.description: A name for the server

header.name: Strict-Transport-Security
header.description: A HSTS Policy informing the HTTP client how long to cache the HTTPS only policy and whether this applies to subdomains.

header.name: Transfer-Encoding
header.description: The form of encoding used to safely transfer the entity to the user. Currently defined methods are: chunked, compress, deflate, gzip, identity.

header.name: Vary
header.description: Tells downstream proxies how to match future request headers to decide whether the cached response can be used rather than requesting a fresh one from the origin server.

header.name: X-Content-Type-Options
header.description: The only defined value, "nosniff", prevents Internet Explorer from MIME-sniffing a response away from the declared content-type

header.name: X-Frame-Options
header.description: Clickjacking protection: "deny" - no rendering within a frame, "sameorigin" - no rendering if origin mismatch

header.name: X-XSS-Protection
header.description: Cross-site scripting (XSS) filter

response.body: {"message":{"text":"Your reservation for 7 guests at Lazy Bear on June 6th 7:00 PM is confirmed.","actions":[{"text":"Add to iCalendar","payload":"icalendar","_id":"5b2bf87358f27000221c9436","uri":"","type":"postback"},{"text":"Add to Google Calendar","payload":"google calendar","_id":"5b2bf87358f27000221c9435","uri":"","type":"postback"},{"text":"Add to Outlook","payload":"outlook","_id":"5b2bf87358f27000221c9434","uri":"","type":"postback"}],"type":"text","role":"appMaker","received":1529608307.362,"authorId":"00uejytoekz520ZEG0h7","avatarUrl":"https://media.smooch.io/5ac3da9539fe6c0022447259/icons/appicon.jpg","name":"Galifrey","_id":"5b2bf87358f27000221c9433","source":{"type":"api"}},"conversation":{"unreadCount":2,"_id":"884ac26bfa519a0bb4cb0162","appMakerLastRead":1529608307.362,"appUserLastRead":1529607811.481}}

request.description:
### For more information
- Guide: [https://docs.smooch.io/guide/sending-messages/](https://docs.smooch.io/guide/sending-messages/)
- API Docs: [https://docs.smooch.io/rest/#message-actions](https://docs.smooch.io/rest/#message-actions)

See the [capabilities grid](https://docs.smooch.io/guide/channel-capabilities/) for message-type support across channels.

header.name: Cache-Control
header.description: Tells all caching mechanisms from server to client whether they may cache this object. It is measured in seconds

header.name: Connection
header.description: Options that are desired for the connection

header.name: Content-Length
header.description: The length of the response body in octets (8-bit bytes)

header.name: Content-Type
header.description: The mime type of this content

header.name: Date
header.description: The date and time that the message was sent

header.name: ETag
header.description: An identifier for a specific version of a resource, often a message digest

header.name: Expires
header.description: Gives the date/time after which the response is considered stale

header.name: Poll-Interval
header.description: Custom header

header.name: Pragma
header.description: Implementation-specific headers that may have various effects anywhere along the request-response chain.

header.name: Server
header.description: A name for the server

header.name: Strict-Transport-Security
header.description: A HSTS Policy informing the HTTP client how long to cache the HTTPS only policy and whether this applies to subdomains.

header.name: Vary
header.description: Tells downstream proxies how to match future request headers to decide whether the cached response can be used rather than requesting a fresh one from the origin server.

header.name: X-Content-Type-Options
header.description: The only defined value, "nosniff", prevents Internet Explorer from MIME-sniffing a response away from the declared content-type

header.name: X-Frame-Options
header.description: Clickjacking protection: "deny" - no rendering within a frame, "sameorigin" - no rendering if origin mismatch

header.name: X-XSS-Protection
header.description: Cross-site scripting (XSS) filter

    "role": "appUser",
    "type": "image",
    "text": "Do you have this jacket in stock at the moment?",
    "mediaUrl": "https://smooch.io/static_assets/images/shoplifter/double-breasted-coat.jpg",
    "mediaType": "image/jpeg"
}

header.name: Date

header.name: ETag
header.description: An identifier for a specific version of a resource, often a message digest

header.name: Expires
header.description: Gives the date/time after which the response is considered stale

header.name: Poll-Interval
header.description: Custom header

header.name: Pragma
header.description: Implementation-specific headers that may have various effects anywhere along the request-response chain.

header.name: Server
header.description: A name for the server

header.name: Strict-Transport-Security
header.description: A HSTS Policy informing the HTTP client how long to cache the HTTPS only policy and whether this applies to subdomains.

header.name: Vary
header.description: Tells downstream proxies how to match future request headers to decide whether the cached response can be used rather than requesting a fresh one from the origin server.

header.name: X-Content-Type-Options
header.description: The only defined value, "nosniff", prevents Internet Explorer from MIME-sniffing a response away from the declared content-type

header.name: X-Frame-Options
header.description: Clickjacking protection: "deny" - no rendering within a frame, "sameorigin" - no rendering if origin mismatch

header.name: X-XSS-Protection
header.description: Cross-site scripting (XSS) filter

request.description:
### For more information
- Guide: [https://docs.smooch.io/guide/sending-messages/](https://docs.smooch.io/guide/sending-messages/)
- API Docs: [https://docs.smooch.io/rest/?shell#carousel](https://docs.smooch.io/rest/?shell#carousel)

See the [capabilities grid](https://docs.smooch.io/guide/channel-capabilities/) for message-type support across channels.

response.name: Carousel Example

header.name: Cache-Control
header.description: Tells all caching mechanisms from server to client whether they may cache this object. It is measured in seconds

header.name: Connection
header.description: Options that are desired for the connection

header.name: Content-Length
header.description: The length of the response body in octets (8-bit bytes)

header.name: Content-Type
header.description: The mime type of this content

header.name: Date
header.description: The date and time that the message was sent

header.name: ETag
header.description: An identifier for a specific version of a resource, often a message digest

header.name: Expires
header.description: Gives the date/time after which the response is considered stale

header.name: Poll-Interval
header.description: Custom header

header.name: Pragma
header.description: Implementation-specific headers that may have various effects anywhere along the request-response chain.

header.name: Server
header.description: A name for the server

header.name: Strict-Transport-Security
header.description: A HSTS Policy informing the HTTP client how long to cache the HTTPS only policy and whether this applies to subdomains.

header.name: Vary
header.description: Tells downstream proxies how to match future request headers to decide whether the cached response can be used rather than requesting a fresh one from the origin server.

header.name: X-Content-Type-Options
header.description: The only defined value, "nosniff", prevents Internet Explorer from MIME-sniffing a response away from the declared content-type

header.name: X-Frame-Options
header.description: Clickjacking protection: "deny" - no rendering within a frame, "sameorigin" - no rendering if origin mismatch

header.name: X-XSS-Protection
header.description: Cross-site scripting (XSS) filter

response.body:
{"message":{"text":"1. Scandinave Getaway
Enjoy massage treatments situated in a serene natural forest with an on-site bistro serving healthy local fare
Learn more: http://smoochopify.myshopify.com/products/big-hat

2. Brewery Tour
Explore Boston's thriving brewpub scene and taste roughly 18 types of beer on these guided morning and evening brewery tours.
Learn more: http://smoochopify.myshopify.com/products/big-hat
Check availability: http://smoochopify.myshopify.com/products/big-hat

3. Whale Watching
Experience the marine wildlife on this guided, 3-hour whale-watching cruise around the National Marine Sanctuary.
Learn more: http://smoochopify.myshopify.com/products/big-hat
Check availability: https://ticketing.bostonharborcruises.com/WebStore/shop/ViewItems.aspx?CG=EXCR&C=WW

4. French Dining
Gary Danko provides an award-winning combination of classic French cooking and personable yet impeccable service.
Learn more: http://smoochopify.myshopify.com/products/big-hat
Check availability: http://smoochopify.myshopify.com/products/big-hat

5. Seafood Cuisine
Ostra focuses on specialty seafood and the cuisine highlights the natural and fresh flavors of each dish.
Learn more: http://smoochopify.myshopify.com/products/big-hat
